website_summaries.verdict: Oculus Go is VR for the masses: A self-contained, standalone virtual reality headset that's portable, affordable and delivers a great experience for the price.
pros: A completely self-contained, standalone, no-phone-or-PC-necessary VR system
Sharp-looking display and effective built-in speakers with spatial audio
Oculus setup app works with iOS and Android phones
Connects for social chats with Go, Gear VR and Oculus Rift owners
cons: It's a sit-down experience (no room tracking)

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this and expect to watch any videos lasting more the 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product specifically to watch 360 videos. But it automatically shuts off after 5 minutes unless you move the remote. This is a huge design flaw and makes this device useless if you want to do anything else other then play VR games. If you don’t move that controller after 5 minutes the device turns off. Even if you’re moving the head set around this device will turn off when the remote isn’t moved.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Dallas

customer_reviews.title: broke in a week... manufacturer refused to issue replacement
customer_reviews.text: One of these broke with in a week, not physically, but stopped working. Oculus would not honor a replacement as they said i took the device out of the US. May be they should sell them anchored into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased the oculus go a week ago, everything worked fine and it was pretty cool. Then the controller quit working after about 4 times using the thing. Doesn't work without it. So you can't call anyone in support for oculus. You can do a chat but he ended up saying you have to do a hard reset???? I just bought it. Now I can't sign into the account and I can't reset it. So I will be asking Amazon for a refund! If they had any tech support this might have worked.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert M.

customer_reviews.title: I would like to use this but it won't
customer_reviews.text: I would like to use this but it won't,won't turn on,won't do anything and they're customer support is impossible too reach.Very sad,because I think it would be a good product.Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: tophat

customer_reviews.title: entry level VR at a great price
customer_reviews.text: very impressive, to be honest - especially at $200. the visual clarity of the 1440p screen is so much better than my PSVR. everything I've tried so far has been nice and smooth - granted I haven't tried too many things yet since I just received it today. menus seen very intuitive as well - everything works how you think they should work. the only negative thing I can think of is how much pressure it puts on my face. but again, this thing is $200 so it's not gonna be the most comfortable headset. all in all, very impressive package.
customer_reviews.author: Nomi

customer_reviews.title: disabled USB port and turns on by itself so it's always dead!
customer_reviews.text: John Carmack, Oculus CTO, claimed he'd enable the USB port but never did. And unless you keep this charging when you're not using it, it'll randomly turn on, and then deplete the battery, so it'll always be dead when you want to use it. And even at a full charge, it runs out quickly. I would have gotten the next generation Oculus Quest next, but now I'll never trust the Oculus name again.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite ready for primetime!
customer_reviews.text: The good, the bad, the UGLY! The good; The interface is SPOT ON! The unit has great fit and finish The bad; The resolution is nothing like my 4k TV or even my Samsung S8 phone screen. In the sample 360 videos, the definition was inferior, faces would go by with little definition, while the backgrounds were muddy. Not sure if it is the 360 filming, but I could see the pixels, and when I went to Netflix, it also was not nearly as crisp as my TV The ugly; I had to return the unit and will have to wait for the next generation!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry Herman

customer_reviews.title: Never worked. Just crashes. No support
customer_reviews.text: Well it doesn’t work. Headset won’t go past the remote setup tutorial without crashing. Says “oculus runtime has stopped working”. Can’t talk to a live support person. Never got use it. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: William S Knopp

customer_reviews.title: Screen resolution disappoints
customer_reviews.text: The concept is amazing and I was so excited to try it on and enjoy watching my movies and TV shows. However, the screen resolution is a joke! It feels that I went back almost 10 years when DVD 480p was just introduced! Although it says 1080p or higher, I was really disappointed by the picture quality. The experience though is cool but gaming is fun but again it fall short on picture quality which I believe is the key here. I wouldn't recommended to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Keem

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down the Best VR Bang for Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: How can you beat the price on this thing!? It feels great, runs great, and is quality VR for relatively cheap! You immediately get a full library of games to choose from (with a few free ones off the bat). But the real star here is the multimedia capabilities. Watching video in your own cinema in VR is quite the luxury. Two small cons: 1) you need a mobile phone (apple or andriod) to set the GO up. 2) Oculus is owned by Facebook so it may be a little sketchy on privacy But those two cons are not enough to even drop this device down to 4 stars. It is a great, value device that deserves its 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Romanski

customer_reviews.title: The picture is very blurry and no way to focus it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset for my grandson's Christmas. I set it up per instructions with high expectations. Needless to say I was very disappointed!! The picture quality is what I would expect out of a toy that cost no more than 5 dollars. Everything is so blurry and even worse there is no way to focus it. When I researched VR Headsets the Oculus Go was rated #1. I would not recommend this to anyone!!! Can someone recommend which VR works the best?
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Enter into ANOTHER WORLD!!! Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so much better than the Samsung Gear VR seeing as it is a standalone device. No more using my cellphone as a screen, this screen is built in! No more phone over heating! And the remote controller that comes with this is so cool! you can see the laser pointer in the game! Check out this video me and my friend made testing out the games! I hope this was helpful! Cheers
customer_reviews.author: MindSeedTV

customer_reviews.title: Suitable only for people with "average" IPD
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for people with IPD of 70mm or higher. Oculus, you should have added a mechanical IPD wheel so people with IPD not equal to 63mm would enjoy VR too. But with fixed distance between lenses one eye is always blurry...
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well with my glasses, despite them being within tolerance
customer_reviews.text: Glasses spacer did not help with side arms being pressed and too subject to moving lens while adjusting headset. Nose area lead to fogging of glasses if not set just right. Interface was clunky and too spread out. Browser controls were not laid out well and active tab was too small for viewing. Too much wasted space that could be used in browser viewing.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: The iPhone of VR
customer_reviews.text: I always loved the idea of VR but could never be bothered to buy a PC (I'm a Mac user). It also sounded expensive for a gimmick (I think initially the Rift was like 600 US). At 199 with no other requirements, it's an easy buy & is set up in 5 minutes. I had tons of fun and used it every day I had it so far. Great concept, great execution! I showed it to a couple of friends and almost everyone wants to get one of their own. Would highly recommend this to anyone who is just a casual user like myself
customer_reviews.author: Simmenfl

customer_reviews.title: Not there yet!
customer_reviews.text: The big plus is it's portable and if you don't have a powerful computer - you don't have to buy anything else. Negatives outweigh positives however. Picture quality is like 240p! Yes you can watch plenty of content online as well as download movies onto Oculus memory, but this low quality is not acceptable. I sampled 4k UHD format and 1080p from both online and downloading to the memory. Terrible...this is 21 century - give us something better! The free games are very simplistic and not very entertaining after you played them for a day.
customer_reviews.author: T-mo customer

customer_reviews.title: The experience you get is life changing. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: Before this purchase, the only other time I’ve tried VR was at the National Aviary in their bird simulator (which was awesome but way too short). I put this on and the fully immersive experience makes me feel like I’m there. It’s amazing! Oculus has made a truly incredible product. There’s so much you can do with the Oculus Go right away and without any additional cost. I know this product is going to be something I use on a regular basis from now on. It makes me actually like and want to support Facebook. What they are doing with VR and the Oculus brand is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works, but it is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple of months. For the past one month it's been sitting in my closet untouched. Aside from the novelty, VR is still looking for a reason to exist. The picture for streaming video is...better than previous headsets, but still not as good as your 6 year old tv (or older). The roller coaster game is the most immersive thing, but after the initial novelty of vertigo becomes old hat, there is little appeal. There's just nothing here to hold interest more than a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Bopp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if you're interested in trying out VR
customer_reviews.text: My only beef with this set is the battery life. After a few months, the battery life really starts to deteriorate from what was already not great battery life. Aside from battery life, this set rocks. It is light, so you can wear it for longer periods without discomfort. It is comfortable to wear. You can wear it with glasses without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Householder

customer_reviews.title: Not bad and worth the experience
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for better quality than PSVR. Oculus Go definitely has better visuals but the apps and games are lackluster. I also think there is a quality control issue because some apps don’t work and surprised Google is not regulating what is it allowed to be sold in the store. Most of the games are casual or don’t cater to my preference.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny P

customer_reviews.title: I hate this 😠 product.
customer_reviews.text: Well I've had this product for about 6 months and I can't even use it. It gets extremely hot, flashes me heat warnings and then shuts off. All in 20 minutes. I have not had a good experience with this product. Maybe it's defected... I wrote a message to Oculus a bit back and still I'm waiting for a reply. TOTALLY SUCKS! Right now I won't refer this product to anyone. Poor poor POOR customer service and questionable product. I will write again when I receive assistance. Until then this product SUCKS 😒?
customer_reviews.author: E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Needs to work on Battery management.  And software.
customer_reviews.text: They really need to work on the Software part, and the battery management. This thing is always turning itself on, i rarely manage to get it to stay charged. Also needs a Tour guide mode, so i can put it on grandma and see instantly on the tv what she sees, and can guide her through the tour of the grand canyon she wanted to watch. When you hand the thing off to a 2nd person it goes back to the home screen, which is a pain. Needs to be able to stream straight to my chromecast, without going through facebook. Too much lag that way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addicted Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good start but need to improve things if they want this to be real product
customer_reviews.text: A good start but several things need to be worked out. 1) They need to improve resolution. 2) need to add ability for device to adjust for individual visual acuity so glasses won’t be required. 3) improve battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful picture quality!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It says that it has “crystal clear optics” but the picture quality is terrible! The only thing you can change about the picture is the brightness. If I had known, that before, I never would’ve purchased the device.
customer_reviews.author: MNP

customer_reviews.title: Lagging and loading issues
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this item for 2 days and as much as i like it, ive had nothing but issues with loading and lagging. I have high speed internet so im sure thats not it. I never had this problem with the gear vr. But with the go, i will start watching something, then the loading circle appears part way through and will no longer load anything. Even if i press the home button, nothing will load on the screen, just black squares with moving stripes of gray. I have to shut it down and restart it again every time.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Holden

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money yet
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. For family and gaming use, I don’t think it was worth the money. We tried it for a couple days and were disappointed with app choices and quality. I suppose this might be nice for single dudes... if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Ribbon Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Happy camper
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 different, inexpensive ($12 - $15) headsets with my cell phone and was highly disappointed. Well...I'm not disappointed in the Oculus Go at all. I bought mine on the first day that it was released for sale and have been playing with it for the last week. The ONLY problem that I have encountered is that it is so new that there are not very many web discussion groups or forums out there YET. I'm pretty sure that will change as I think this headset will be very popular. There seem to be a multitude of videos available to run on this device. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Hayes

customer_reviews.title: I <3 VR!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have experience with other VR products other than cardboard for phones. This far exceeds that, and I have been having a lot of fun thus far. It reminds me of first time I got iPhone 3 and spent hours downloading and exploring apps. The apps can be pricey, but I am finding a correlation between higher priced apps and quality. The shooter games are pretty safe bet. The battery seems to go fast. I'd definitely get as much space as possible, I'm already filling it up.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Love the OGO!!!
customer_reviews.text: Read so many reviews and finally bought one after waiting months for it to be released. Exceeded my expectations on every level. Optics are freaking awesome though took a little time to get used to. Hadn’t worn a VR Headset in a few years. I like to sit in front of a fan while wearing so I don’t experience any of the overheating problems some report. Also us a magnetic quick release USB cable to charge while I play. Battery only lasts for 90-120 minutes so having the magnetic quick release cable attached you can easily watch a full length movie. Longest duration I’ve used in a single session was 6 hours straight.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brook

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I like them but it is basically a smartphone operating system that seems to be a variant of Android. Oculus has it locked down so you can not load from the Play Store. Which is disappointing. The technology is getting better but it is not there yet. I found one game that is a funny shooting game and fairly immersive. I think it is more effective as a movie viewer. I can view Showtime on it but cannot view HBO. Which kind of sucks. Amazon Prime works which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Aces&8s

customer_reviews.title: Blurry,Dies quick. Leave it in their stock.
customer_reviews.text: Gets a 3* for it's look and the operating speed that's it! My opinion is do not buy this I had the gear VR when it came out and figured this was a step up, man was I wrong. This is by far not even close to worth the price. Biggest killers for us we're it is blurry, and the battery will die within a hour of fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkibuys

customer_reviews.title: Excellent VR Experience.
customer_reviews.text: Can I tell you how happy I am with this headset? It does exactly what I was hoping it would do. I use the Go primarily for consuming media. My two favorite apps are BigscreenVR and Youtube. With Bigscreen, it seems like I am in a huge movie theater and I can watch movies while talking with people from all over the world. With Youtube I can watch my own personal collection of digital movies and the image is incredibly clear. The only downside is the length of power charge in the headset. I'm charging it almost daily because of how quick this headset consumes power. But I really do enjoy using Oculus Go.
customer_reviews.author: MasterAP

customer_reviews.title: Way Less fogging if any.
customer_reviews.text: Does not have fogging issues like my white Samsung gear VR had. I hope the genuine VR content is added to regularly. The MelodyVR (which is attending concerts and standing where you want to ). The APP said (12may 2018) that its NOT AVAILABLE IN MY REGION.(I'm in New Zealand) Thats always infuriating to read when us non Usa based consumers read that.It seems the "World Wide Web" is only global when they want it suits them. Based on that premise, the Oculus Go should be cheaper for people outside of America, if the content is not going to be the same for all. So minus ! star for being asses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW
customer_reviews.text: The amount of technology and capability you get here for only $200 is truly mind-blowing. As someone who travels a lot, this is an amazing substitute for crappy hotel room TV's and phone/tablet gaming. Once you get past the wow factor, there are a couple minor drawbacks, the onboard audio has no bass, so headphones are a most for an immersive experience, and I'd recommend going with the 64gb version, as even just 10 minutes of a hd VR experience can eat up a gig of storage. Overall though, No regrets, love this!
customer_reviews.author: Tech Medic NJ

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he really loves it. I have tried it and you really feel immersed, so much so that I felt motion sickness. We have had it for a year now and it still works great and easily charges. There are many free videos and games but be aware to really get use out of it, a lot of things are not free. I wold not recommend for anyone with motion sickness or vertigo.
customer_reviews.author: maggiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Worth the initial investment of a VR system
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Christmas Present that everyone in the family fought to use. Basic entry system but worth the small price of your sanity. I went fishing for awhile and sort of phased out. Great gift for young kids, adults and seniors. Tons of titles to choose from. I get motion sick easily (just watching video games sets it off) but I didn’t have any issues with this system for 45+ minutes in VR.
customer_reviews.author: IronSpider6

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic experiences. Worth it to get the unit with more storage.
customer_reviews.text: This thing amazes me every day. REALLY cool for a standalone unit. Everyone I've shown it to is hooked. Good Apps, Great for Hulu, Netflix, Prime watching. Sound is surprisingly awesome. Optics are an A+ when kept clean. Sit down games can be played while it's charging. Get the 64g, storage fills up quick. I have nothing but good things to say about Oculus Go.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Goody

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy in your most comfortable place
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have had the PSVR since launch and I love it. However, the cords that tie you to the machine and having to sit close to the camera limits where you can have the PSVR experience. I have to sit on a folding chair in front of my TV to play PSVR since my couch is too far away. With the Oculus, I can use it anywhere while sitting or laying in any position. I am not tied to being in front of a camera. I can now sit on my comfortable sofa while I enjoy VR. If your primary use is to watch videos or play simple games, then this is a great solution to enjoy VR.
customer_reviews.author: JJR

customer_reviews.title: Image quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this mainly to use as a 3-D viewer for my 3-D videos shot in 5.7 K on the evo insta 360. Even though the pictures and video are in hi-def, the resolution in this viewer is poor. Similar to a picture from a flip phone 20 years ago. The 3D effect is awesome but resolution is not sharp at all, just fuzzy. I was disappointed because I was not expecting this. However, the games and 3-D immersion is pretty cool. For $199 it’s worth it. I look forward to the future improvements I know they are going to make in image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Disanto

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter a while ago and it has been pretty awesome. I will say the battery does not last too long but that is good for me because my daughter would be on it forever if the battery lasted all day. Either way, the product is super easy to use and is really fun. They have some cool stuff on there and it is neat to experience it with a lower cost standalone device. I am assuming this is not as good as some of the devices that require PC's but as a standalone product, what more can you ask for? It is an entry level VR with some fun little games/videos on it.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: For kids? It's incredible.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to setup. Anyone complaining about needing phone...um...who doesn't have a phone? If you already have Facebook on your phone it takes all of 30 seconds to get up and running. Then you don't need your phone from then on out. All games and apps can be downloaded from the VR menu. Having never tested another VR set (other than cheap goggles), the resolution seems great. The games are responsive and easy to download. The controller is simple to understand. For a family of 4, between the parents and the 2 kids (11 and 13), this was a HUGE hit for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: VR should be this easy.
customer_reviews.text: Been using my Samsung phone with Samsung VR since inception. These are better cuz you don't have to buy expensive Samsung phone, don't eat up your phone battery and don't have to put on headphones. Plus you can pull VR videos from your NAS so don't even have to download them to the VR device before viewing. No long tether cuz it's battery powered. Also own Sony VR and HTC Vibe but I use these the most cuz it's just really convenient. Also easy to step out of VR if you get VR sickness. Views same Vids as Samsung VR vids so you can take photos or VR vids with Samsung 360.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level VR set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 15 yo nephew; he had bought some little cardboard something and thought that was cools so I figured this would be a home run. He doesn't have internet at home so I wanted something I could preload with some games that could be played offline. This was perfect. It only has one hand controller and you can't really walk around like in the more expensive models but honestly I played with this thing for a month before I gave it to him and had a ball. Considering getting myself one. For the price it is a great entry level VR Headset.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Finally VR for everyone, everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Price is right. It works. It’s way superior over Google Cardboard. Not as evolved as the rift due to it not having 6 degrees but only 3 degrees of tracking, but a great mobile alternative with impressive VR graphics and a great library of games and apps. It’s also an outstanding media player. Watch Netflix or Hulu on a big screen as long as you have a subscription.Portability is a huge plus. No complaints. It’s great. So much fun and so easy because it’s tetherless. Battery is not an issue for me. I just hook it to a portable charger and it keeps it going. No overheating issues. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: mojojojo77

customer_reviews.title: Not really what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice stand alone VR. But to be honest I was disappointed in the video quality. I wanted to use this to watch 3D movies but it feels like watching a movie theater like screen with 90's TV resolution. My TV has a much better quality than this, and it is a 2010 VIZO 3D TV (1080P). On the Oculus web site it shows a good quality, but it really isn't. It has a lot of great reviews, so I really don't have another VR to compare this too. Maybe I was expecting too much from a VR headset.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could watch movies in bed, let me just say it will emerge you in any movie and because you are wearing it it will block out all surrounding distractions including snacking. when it comes to games it is not the best IMO or rather the selection is not the best so that could change, there are several great VR movies online where you can visit mountains and even space, etc. how about skydiving from the safety of your chair? For the price I am definitely happy with this, the battery life could be better it rarely lasts an entire movie.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Video Is somewhat grainy.
customer_reviews.text: Cool product Video is somewhat grainy and not near 4K quality. Easy to set up but a slight learning curve to maneuver and control. Sound is very good. With better resolution and a higher than 70hz refresh rate this would easily be a 5 Star product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gifts
customer_reviews.text: Between Amazon and another online retailer, I purchased 3 of these today for my 3 techie grandkids. I think they will enjoy watching videos, playing games and listening to music when they can see it all in virtual reality. Update: The kids love these. They have been using them for all sorts of things. The parents don't see their faces for hours.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Just wait for something better or go with Rift...
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to invest in a powerful PC to go with the much more engaging Oculus Rift, so I went with this. Because it is completely self-contained, it only has whatever processing power and storage is in the device. Additionally, it cannot pick on up lateral whole-body movement. This has a really limited experience. I read that the new product from Oculus in 2019 will be self-contained but will have the features of the Rift. Going to try to sell this one and wait for the new product.
customer_reviews.author: William Hawkins II

customer_reviews.title: Short Battery Life.. Cellphone VR experience with 1 simple controller,get Quest Instead
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing ,for the price i guess its an ok entry into Vr but you would be better off getting a Quest, the lenses on the go are horrible and make u feel like ur ina a playstation 1 from 1990's i had similar experience with a cheap cellphone and google cardboard VR box ,The GO was not compatible with my eyes unfortunately as it could not adjust like the Oculus Quest dose, i suggest you "go" for its big brother the quest as it is a massive upgrade full console and viewing experience.
customer_reviews.author: 🎅

customer_reviews.title: After one year of ownership
customer_reviews.text: The product has been rock stable with no technical issues over the past year. I'm still using it several times a week but my wife hasn't used it for many months. I enjoy all of the travel 360 videos out there. Youtube has a bunch. Our neighbor's son has the Oculus Go as well. He told me recently that it's becoming popular at his college to get high and watch 360 animation films on VR headsets. There are a few of those on the Within app.
customer_reviews.author: MLSabo

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't worth the buy, screen door effect was too noticable for me and it wasn't the best screen resolution either. Also battery life was terrible, 2 hours and the device got really hot and told me to stop using it, and this is just from watching Hulu. Also very limited in terms of VR, only 3 degrees of freedom. I knew it would be limited in what it could do, but I didn't expect to dislike it so much. Returned after a couple of days of use
customer_reviews.author: Andrene Newman

customer_reviews.title: Every mother should have one of these
customer_reviews.text: I use it primarily with the free meditation app and it has changed my life. When I am having an especially bad day or have a lot of physical pain from previous injuries, this is my go-to. I read about this being used to treat chronic pain in a magazine, and I am so happy that I took the risk and got this. It is also amazing for games and watching videos on Netflix, but the VR meditation alone made this thing worth the money. I would suggest getting the 64gb if you intend to install lots of apps, but I have been able to make the 32 work too.
customer_reviews.author: am Seal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO GLAD I bought these! I was looking at the VR headsets that you put your iPhone in, along with the inconvenience of taking the phone out of it's current case each time and putting it in the VR headset, the weight would have been to much. These are light weight and the clarity of the apps, it's perfect. I'm not a gamer, I'm using these to stream movies as I work out. I'm very happy with the quality of this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Minimal Screen Door Effect Better Quality Than Oculus Rift. Only 200$!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product!! I own the Oculus Rift for pc and i always loved it, but wanted a better screen because of the sdr or Screen Door Effect, the Oculus Go has just that a better screen with minimal SDE now i can finally sit back at work and watch Netflix or play video-games on the Go. and for that low price of 200$ i mean its literally a no brainer! You Wont Be Dissapointed!!! Imma have to let the older guys i work with try this on and see their Reactions, that alone would be worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Facebook users might like this...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well and graphics are decent for the price, but my biggest problem was Facebook. I wont get into it, but the Venues app required Facebook to use, so I returned this immediately. Im going to wait for Vive Focus. I trust Steam, I dont trust Facebook.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: OCULUS Overheating..Research Before Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Unit is defective after three months of use. Overheating, among many other issues. Research Oculus Go overheating. Contacted Oculus customer service and all they will offer is a REFURBISHED unit. A new, unused unit was defective, can't imagine how well a REFURBISHED unit will function. Another plus, warranty does not begin with REFURBISHED unit, it is from original purchase date, of defective unit. I would never purchase a refurbished electronic item, but this is the best Oculus could do....consider this when purchasing any items from them.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: Mind blown!
customer_reviews.text: So, I’m a total techie with all the toys. I don’t have the words to describe this! When I purchased the Oculus Go, I expected a cool toy. After an initial setup in my smart phone... my jaw dropped. This is AMAZING! Had to order a second one because my better half doesn’t want to take it off either. (And he is techie challenged). To that end... my whole family is ordering one. There are movies, games, social media... and your ARE there. Immersed in the experience. Today I skydived, ran with a velociraptor, had a polar bear in my face, and swam with sharks. This is crazy! You are there. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Carla Stodgel

customer_reviews.title: The entry level vr headset to get
customer_reviews.text: It’s 5 stars because it’s the best vr you can get for 200 dollars. People need to keep in mind that this headset is an entry level headset, made for the mass market, so obviously it won’t be as good as the pc run oculus rift or other expensive headsets. It runs very nice, the touch controller tracking is great, and the apps are awesome for some fun features. The only thing that could be better is having some options for customizing the face foam on the oculus go as the nose section is too big for me but other than that a must buy for people looking to get into vr
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to operate, great picture & sound
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It’s been a real pleasure having this device. It seems to work very well. My husband and I have enjoyed traveling from Amsterdam to Tibet. In fact, we are considering a second Go so we can enjoy our travel experiences together. I use it to watch Netflix in bed. No TV in your room needed. I would buy again. I also purchased a wonderful little case so to protect it and keep light from the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: judyrice47

customer_reviews.title: The device that delivers mass VR adoption...
customer_reviews.text: Oculus has hit a home run in a league with a lot of singles and doubles, and frankly, strikeouts. Untethered! This, coupled with strong performance and graphics, the strongest suite of apps and games, and lastly, an untouchable price.
customer_reviews.author: mooveebuffer

customer_reviews.title: Zero support.  Caution.
customer_reviews.text: ZERO support. I could not link a credit card to buy any new apps and occulus has no phone support and provided absolutely no help in solving this issue. I’m trying to spend more money and they cannot support that. It just says this payment cannot be activated. Opened a ticket and I get a try this or this ...oops sorry working in it etc. Tried new cc, new WiFi new everything. How hard is it to take money. Epic fail and no support. And now all the xmassales on apps are gone. I would look at any other manufacturer except this one. Extremely disappointing. Epic fail occulus.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rai

customer_reviews.title: Good product but still not ready for wide use.
customer_reviews.text: The concept is definitely what we'll have in the future but this product won't get you there yet. It's obviously a prototype that will be developed into something great but, as of today, I still doesn't meed my needs. It needs a better battery life, a better overall vision quality and also a better engine. When I try to watch a live game on ESPN the picture lags and the front gets really hot (it's supposed to get hot but still the hotter it gets the more it lags), and you can't go more than 2 hours on a single charge. To me this product is still not ready but overall it is a very nice experience.
customer_reviews.author: ecate

customer_reviews.title: No VRChat or Beat Saber, Great For Watching Videos
customer_reviews.text: Oculus Go is very nice, but don't expect it to be anything like the Rift, I bought it thinking it would support VRChat, it does not, although VTime is a nice substitute, it also does not support beat saber. What it lacks in 2 handed apps, it makes up for in media. Using the browser, ANY video can wrap around you in 360. The Bigscreen app lets you broadcast your pc screen into vr to work on projects or do pc gaming in vr. I just wish you could get another controller and play 2 handed apps. Not bad, might sell it and upgrade to the quest or rift.
customer_reviews.author: Uriah Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: This is trash. Stuck updating during set up forever, common issue when googled.
customer_reviews.text: Unless the SW is at latest this will will want to download 200-300 mb from internet, but never completes. Very common issue for the GO platform from googling. The app wants location, and bluetooth, network control/access 247. Doesnt complain if you deny local storage. Very disappointed that couldnt even get passed the set up despite being connected to internet.
customer_reviews.author: a.jm

customer_reviews.title: Returned this gave me headaches
customer_reviews.text: I returned this go, didn't like the lenses, lack of adjustment, both to the lenses and the strapping and materials, limited apps with out a jailbreak type scenario made this a headache to use. I also don't believe the quest will be muck better. I instead bought the Rift cables and all; received it today set it up and it had it on for a couple of hours and found it to be comfortable and a much, much better experience. Thanks and I hope people will end up with which ever unit or the Vive will suit them.
customer_reviews.author: V. K. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product...the tech will only get better with time
customer_reviews.text: This thing is truly amazing. Everyone I've shown it off to has been truly impressed. It really does trick your mind into thinking you're somewhere else. Yes, the resolution could be better, and so could the field of view. You kind of feel at times you're looking through a pair of scuba goggles. The tech will get better, I'm sure of it. But for the cost, this thing is pretty amazing already. I can't wait to see what future iterations bring.
customer_reviews.author: bgaviator

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfying experience
customer_reviews.text: It was somewhat fun when I first tried it but there are far too many issues. Discription claims crystal clear display but there is still the screen door affect and the sides of the display blur/double vision in any 180/360 degree video. Tried watching Endgame on Netflix with a full charge and barely made it 60% in and with half the storage space being used up before you ever download anything ( 64GB was really 30GB ) noway you can fit what they claim you can on it. If they dropped the price to $100 I would recommend it but that won't happen so save your money.
customer_reviews.author: DurangoRed

customer_reviews.title: Per Headset it was Made in 2008! Died after using a couple times!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely Unhappy with this Oculus Go. Read all reviews, did research online before buying product and decided to get it. When setting it up & looking for serial # on headset - I noticed that the Manufacture Date on my SO CALLED “NEW” product was from back in 2008 - 12 years ago! So much for a NEW product! I decided to give it a shot anyway and after just a couple times using the Oculus Go, it Completely DIED on me. Wouldn’t even charge or start! Just beeped at me. I immediately returned it. Tried to get a hold of the Oculus Company - Not even an 800 # to Contact.
customer_reviews.author: SWaltman

customer_reviews.title: Startling visual effects... more work to be done
customer_reviews.text: The headset fits well. IT's easy to set up. The initial impression is WOW. But the resolution is so blurry that it seriously detracts from the experience. I wear glasses and I made every attempt to adjust things. Others with perfect vision used them too. The same is true for all. Very blurry... plus a visible grid pattern overlaying the actual images. My excitement for VR long term is undiminished. Perhaps I should have invested more money in higher end gear.... or perhaps it's just a matter of time until somebody perfects the technology and the experience. A lot of smart people are working on the problem. I'd recommend waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Fowler

customer_reviews.title: I get lost in another world
customer_reviews.text: This met my expectations I wanted to watch movies in a virtual theater environment and this headset Definetly delivers its very comfortable to wear and easy to connect and set up ... In will upgrade to an Oculus Quest in the near future this Oculus go is great as a media player and even some games ... bigscreenvr is an awesome movie goin experience in virtual Reality
customer_reviews.author: Allen Comardelle

customer_reviews.title: Impressive headset for the price but not used that much!
customer_reviews.text: So after using the Oculus Go for a month I decided to return it. It’s definitely a cool product but the resolution looks so grainy similar to 480 and 720p I find I just watch Netflix and YouTube on my phone. It’s impressive to have a self contained VR headset but it’s just not realistic enough to actually use it for long periods of time I would often get a headache after 30min.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Strauss

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF RECEIVING A RETURNED DEFECTIVE ITEM
customer_reviews.text: This "Go" had previously been returned because of "unit is overheating" warning after only a few minutes of use. I understand that sometimes an item can be defective -- nothing is perfect. But, that this unit had been previously returned and then resold is unforgivable. The person's name, games, etc. was still visible. The seller did not even do a factory reset. I did, just in case they sell it again this guy's information will not be passed on. NOTE: If you have to returned items that have you set up a profile, be sure to do a factory reset before returning.
customer_reviews.author: JORDAN PEACE

customer_reviews.title: Cool product; free VR movies. FAst shipping
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping! Excellent price. I got the quest for my grandson and decided to get me this as I liked the idea of watching movies as if your in it. Haven't tried it yet but kids said the apps are good. Cant wait to give it a go...grannies can have fun too! Frankly, I think this is the better affordable option until quest develops more realistic apps rather than all simple graphic limited apps. Youtube VR movies for O1 are free but quest are 20-50 bucks and honestly not yet worth it. But hey, he's happy and was the gift most wanted for Christmas; grandma happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Rosita

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after two weeks of use. No troubleshooting or restarting helped in fixing the issue (it just froze at “loading”). It was a surprise to discover that the Oculus belongs to Facebook and that Facebook doesn’t have a strong customer service. I was unable to reach anyone for help. Luckily, the Amazon customers service has helped to resolve the problem in one night and I got my replacement (which I hope does not malfunction).
customer_reviews.author: thankyoumoreplease

customer_reviews.title: Best 200$ I have spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.text: All i can say is Awesome. wearing now while writing this review. No need for tons of research, trust me, just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: The Oculus does not work properly.... It would not connect to the internet.....I would not recommend it to any one. We tried to work with it and even talked with other people who had this...The one we received is defective.... We can only do a few things with it. but tried to work with it and the deadline to return it was 2 days past. It's ok to do a few things but not to the potential that it is suppose to have.....very disappointed. We tried to reach the company for support and it doesn't work ---you can't talk to anyone for technical support.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Facebook. Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Oculus in the beginning used it with my Samsung phone. I deleted my Facebook account due to, to many hackers trying to attack. One of the reasons why I bought the VR was to watch movies from Hulu. Now such a disapointment I can't watch Hulu they are no longer affiliated and I can't get into my Samsung apps. All because I no longer have a Facebook account. So disappointed I paid over $300.00 for this device to have it take away the reasons why I bought it. Not feeling you facebook.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A. McGervey

customer_reviews.title: lacks clarity
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, but the trade off for the crisp clear pictures on HD (and 4k) tvs and pc monitors just for the 360 view wasn't worth it to me. It's hard to feel "immersed" with a fuzzy/blurry view. It works as advertised, just not that fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son loves this system. It came completely ready to play. He feels as if he is really in the game each and every time he uses it. He is far sighted and can easily use his glasses with it, although many games have magnifications that allow him to play without his glasses. Easily adjusts to fit almost anyone. Would recommend this for anyone wanting virtual reality play. Very portable for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Bogantes

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The only negative comment I have... Battery life sucks, I only get about 1.5 hours before it needs to re-charge, so I usually plug mine in when I'm using it. The unit automatically turns itself on and off, this feature may have a couple issues which are contributing to the poor battery life. I said, "may be contributing", because I still have poor battery life after shutting off this feature. (You can shut off by installing the the Oculus Go app and pairing the headset to your smart phone. After pairing, open the app on your phone and tap settings in the bottom right corner, there you'll find the option to turn this feature on and off.)
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great ENTRY LEVEL VR
customer_reviews.text: The first Oculus Go I received was DOA, but Amazon replaced it quickly. The device has lots of limitations: Frenzel lenses, single 3 axis controler, limited (non expandable) memory, 2hour-ish battery life and lower resolution that more expensive models. However, what this devices does is allow you to play in VR and get the sensation of VR now. Being able to explore a virtual 3D space that surrounds you is eye opening and mind expanding. While I'm sure better devices will be available over the next year, this device offers an approachable gateway to VR for those interested in the experience and possibilities. At the price point, I think that's a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Pimpernel Sandybanks

customer_reviews.title: WAY BETTER THAN GALAXY GEAR
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to be super technical here i think that's been covered very well by the other folks. What i will say is i started with VR using a Galaxy 7 Edge and the Gear VR headset...this little $200 beauty FAR surpasses the abilities of a the smart phone vr. The biggest problem i found with the Galaxy is it stuttered so damn much visually. This has NONE of that. It is so smooth and quick and 99% stutter free. I was going to buy a Galaxy 9 with hopes that they'd improved the video quality, but now i can say i'm going to save my money and not upgrade my phone, with Oculus Go there's no need.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O.

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This is my first VR device. Me and my friends are completely blown away by it. I am not comparing this with any such device as i dont know about them. But for its price and the VR videos i can see, it is definitely worth a buy. Also i do own a 360 degree camera. So when i take videos out of it and explore in this, it is just amazing. Vijay
customer_reviews.author: Vijay

customer_reviews.title: Great fun device
customer_reviews.text: Love these things I watch Netflix on them a lot and they are always comfortable. I get about two hours out of the battery. I will say volume is low even at maximum setting so sometimes it is hard to hear certain things. Games on it are fun I have a roller coaster game on mine and it really makes you feel like your on one. Picture is crystal clear and beautiful feels like you are in a movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: tervis collector

customer_reviews.title: Buy this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Very fun toy You must be sure to direct your eyes to the top of the mask. The mask is comfy a half hour then it starts to dig into your face. It will leave bright red marks on your face. Lol but it’s so fun you won’t mind. Get the Jurassic blue app Right away. Just please do it, and space walk is fun but dizzying and you might get sick. It’s the best 200 I spent and really livens up my 400 sq ft living space. Buy it have fun set up is a breeze. It does make you warm kinda wearing it on your face I noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I give up on this thing, it's always had random little quirks but now I can't launch any of my apps because it says it can't connect to the internet, despite being able to browse websites with the browser, I've tried restarting it multiple times and factory restoring it.. don't feel like wasting any more time with it... also why do I need to install an app on my phone to manage it? that needs my location and is made by facebook? ya no thanks
customer_reviews.author: FLECOM

customer_reviews.title: So fun and immersive
customer_reviews.text: So, on technology alone, this thing is fantastic. The apps are fun, some extremely immersive. I have paid for some cheaper apps, but haven't gotten some of the higher priced apps. Most have been quite entertaining. I do wish the battery power was better, but, you can still get about a good hour or more of entertainment depending on how intensive the apps are. I'm glad I made this purchase, some of the educational apps are very cool as well.
customer_reviews.author: G.I. McB

customer_reviews.title: May work for some but for me all they did was hurt my eyes.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. There is no adjustment for those who do not wish to wear glasses with them at the same time. And they looked pixelated and out of focus no matter what I did. These may work for some. People, but for me there just hurt my eyes. No adjustment for pupilary distance either. I would not recommend to others unless you have tested them before. I gather I am. Not alone with having issues.
customer_reviews.author: Garret

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up but: > Uncomfortable because it is relatively heavy > Although a spacer is provided for eye glasses, there's still some distortion > I'm legally blind in my right eye so I didn't expect the 3D affect but the remaining affect was not worth the discomfort and wearing hassle.
customer_reviews.author: MikeSz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but..
customer_reviews.text: Occulus Go is great for what I want it to do. I find it absolutely fabulous. However it is not 'standalone'. While it doe not require wires or anything after setup, it does require a phone FOR the setup. I worried at first because mine is a very old phone that I do not want to change, but I had to download the Occulus App and thankfully it worked. It is beautiful once it works and yes, 'standalone' even though you still need that wifi connection through your phone. Weird but it works. Ideally, it should come with internal wifi. I don't see why we have to go through this tediously annoying setup.
customer_reviews.author: Webster person

customer_reviews.title: There is something for everyone here, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: there is something for everyone here. I got this for myself during “Cyber Week” for a great deal! I took it home with me for Christmas, definitely get a case for it. My sister and her friends loved it. My grandma enjoyed the NatGeo videos and I almost had to pry it from my dads hands when I left! I think I’m going to have to get my dad one for his birthday. The most shocking approval is from my wife. She has found quite a few things that she likes on this too.
customer_reviews.author: The Baxters

customer_reviews.title: Much better then Gear VR
customer_reviews.text: Really kool. I have used almost all versions of google VR. So here i can easily compare gear vr with Oculus VR. Oculus VR is far better then gear vr. I am not sure its because of optics or the media quality. The response is much much faster. In gear vr i have to wait too long to go home page or navigate.But Oculus Go is very quick. If i rate Oculus go at 10 then gear VR would be 5. The content is very clear and sharp.Of course not like 1080p but at current standards, i say it wont disappoint. For 200$ price point it worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Santosh G

customer_reviews.title: Problem with an item and a  customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This is horrible process, the item is not working good as per description when listed , it is overheats, the battery drains too quickly, it is a lie , cannot hold the charge, I returned the product, the seller saying remove negative feedback then will refund , I did removed to save their reputation to get my money back then now manipulating the process refunding me partially, it is a scam , it is fraud, do not buy or recommend, you will have lot to deal when they don’t want to refund money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonka

customer_reviews.title: Only one major flaw if you wear glasses...
customer_reviews.text: Really like the device. Tons of content available. Fits well on the head. Only problem... glasses wearers will need to purchase an aftermarket product in order for your glasses not to touch the lenses of the device and rub or scratch it. Prescription lenses for them are about $100.00. The aftermarket part can be purchased for less than $20.00 and is almost required for comfort. Some anti-fog cleaner could come in handy too to prevent fog on the lenses. Performance wise, it’s a good unit. Would recommend if you want a good starter VR headset.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$ - 2 uses and it stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews prior to purchasing and there were several that mentioned this item was a waste of $$ which is too bad, because when it does work, it was really neat. However, it seems like the unit overheats quickly and now after 2 uses (playing games too, not even downloading or watching movies...) the unit will not turn back on. We have tried charging it, doing a hard reboot and everything, nothing happens. The outside light comes on like it's trying, but there is no picture, no sound and nothing is happening now. Returning to get full refund. Total Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find this for a good deal on Black Friday and really wanted to love it but... the screen was blurry and pixelated, the content was boring. I've tried other VR stuff at all different price ranges and levels, even at pro shops. I guess I was just spoiled. Maybe this is good for kids but I sent it back. I played with it for 2 weeks or more. The battery life is also HORRIBLE. I mean you might get 30mins and if you plug it in, it gets really hot and starts warning of overheating. It's just overpriced cheap for me...
customer_reviews.author: zachus

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I like the speakers, it makes it easy to pass them around. It shuts off way too fast making it impossible for you to set up the next person without them having to do something. I say that because I have tried to let my older friends and relatives use it they don't understand and if I set it up and take it off it shuts down. I would say if you want it to do a lot of things (move when you move) get the upgrade. If you want to just have fun and aren't wanting to spend a lot this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Finally, Life Makes Sense Again
customer_reviews.text: I am not really a fan of anything that Facebook has purchased, but credit should be given where credit is due. This is a really fun toy! Great for watching 3D movies or 360 YouTube videos. It actually looks super fantastic with its graphics and sounds great too. I actually highly recommend this for the value. Especially if you're getting into the world of VR and were wanting to test the waters before investing into something huge. It never hurts to have a toss-around headset!
customer_reviews.author: SirEpicIndividual

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but not for serious video or movie watching
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and the head motion tracking is pretty good. The screen resolution is not what I was expecting and getting the unit positioned right for my eyes to focus on the screen can be a bit tricky. Unit frequently freezes requiring a hard reboot. Hoping a new system update will soon resolve this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ewert

product_meta.title: Oculus Go 32GB - Standalone Virtual Reality Headset
product_meta.description: Oculus Go is the easiest way to jump into the world of virtual reality. For the first time, Oculus brings you a truly standalone VR headset-with no additional hardware, computers, or devices required. Oculus Go is portable, comfortable, and easy to use. Just put it on, switch it on, and watch a movie on a 30-foot screen, grab a front row seat at a sold out concert, play games right at the center of the action, or hang out with friends like never before. Requires a smartphone, the Oculus app (free download) and Internet access for setup.
feature_bullets: True Standalone VR - no additional devices, computers, or gaming consoles required
Lightweight Headset - designed with innovative, breathable fabrics and injection foam molding developed for professional athletes
Wide Quad, Fast-Switch LCD - dramatically improves visual clarity and reduces screen-door effect
Integrated Spatial Audio - speakers built into the headset, transporting you straight into VR and making the headset easy to share with someone else
In the Box : VR Headset, Controller, Glasses Spacer

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
